thread.title: Patient attacked at Washington hospital as US funds at risk
thread.title_full: Patient attacked at Washington hospital as US funds at risk - US News

author: USNews
title: Patient attacked at Washington hospital as US funds at risk
text:
With US funds at risk, Washington psychiatric hospital sees another patient-on-patient attack Western State Hospital is shown Thursday, Oct. 8, 2015, in Lakewood, Wash. So far in 2015, federal regulators have sent notices to the psychiatric hospital that conditions were so dangerous for patients they threatened to cut millions of dollars in funding unless the problems were fixed. (AP Photo/Ted S. Warren)
Associated Press Oct. 15, 2015 | 5:11 p.m. EDT + More By MARTHA BELLISLE, Associated Press
SEATTLE (AP) â€” A patient attacked another patient at Washington state's largest psychiatric hospital this week as federal regulators decide whether to cut millions of dollars to the facility over safety concerns.
The medical staff at Western State Hospital says the number of violent episodes is rising because staffing levels are inadequate.
The federal Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services sent a 90-day termination notice to the hospital on Sept. 21 after investigators said staffers mishandled a previous patient-on-patient assault.
It was the hospital's third warning of a funding cut this year. It receives about $16 million from the agency annually.
The federal agency says they're aware of the most recent patient-on-patient attack, which happened Monday, and if the hospital doesn't meet its standards by December, the facility will lose funding.
